attributes.action: prevent any public or private organisation, including the government, from creating a national database of e-mails and internet communication records for any purpose.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to prevent any public or private organisation, including the government, from creating a national database of e-mails and internet communication records for any purpose.

This includes creating a national database of all e-mails and other communications that take place via the Internet within the UK for any purpose.

The Government proposes that a national database of all e-mails be created allowing anyone with authority to access any information passed via e-mail through UK ISPs; we ask the Prime Minister to stop this breach of privacy regarding both personal and business information and other data.

The UK Government does not need this information, for any purpose including to prevent crime and terrorism; we again ask the Prime Minister to prevent this from passing in Parliament and forcing ISPs and other organisations to comply to such an outrageous demand.

Instead we ask that the Prime Minister consider other options and ask the nation their opinions on such an important issue.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
